Tooltips not usable with dropdown menus
data.body:
When using the standard ButtonWidget tooltip stuff the tooltip appears (or should I say, doesn't appear) underneath the dropdown menu so you can't actually see it when hovering over items. Happens at least in the RA mod.

data.title: Can target line be removeable?
data.body: Target line is a good thing, but when my army is big, and there will be like sunshine all over my screen when I command my unit. Actually I used to like no target line. If not bother, can target line be an option?

data.title: Display some output in server console after loading mod
data.body:
There should be some kind of status message that tells either if the mod/server failed to load/start, or if the server started successfully.
This will save alot of time when running servers, instead of going on the game, checking to see if it's there / going on the website to see if the game is running.

data.body: normal mode works as expected

data.title: Added Gates to Red Alert
data.body:
This adds gates https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/3196 to the game so that can be manually opened, script triggered or run automatized. It is done in a simple fashion reusing the existing https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits#transforms. They don't interact with path-finding.

You can use http://resource.openra.net/maps/1711 for testing purposes.

data.title: Game writes Logfiles suddenly in the Game Directory... :(
data.body:
One of the last Changes which worse Merged to bleed, breaks the logic to write LogFiles on there Desired Locations. Now in some cases the Log File will written into the Game Directory!

Git tracks this files as "new" files :/
In this Case i had an Exception.log in the game Dir!

data.title: Update to MaxMind GeoIP2 .NET version 2.1.0
data.body: We were using a pre-release version before. I also updated the http://dev.maxmind.com/geoip/geoip2/geolite2/ database.

data.title: Implement terrain heightmaps
data.body:
![grid](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/4948922/4490f21a-66ae-11e4-8140-94d6308e9032.png)

This adds engine and map format support for terrain heightmaps using the metadata introduced in #6855.
A new TS test map is included to demonstrate these capabilities.

The focus of this is specifically on the terrain: there is a bunch of gameplay code that is not yet height aware, and this leads to a bunch of bugs on the test map (such as the glitchy shroud, aircraft that fly underground, building placement, etc).  These can be fixed in future PRs.

data.title: Force at least one render per tick during regular gameplay.
data.body: Fixes #6867.

data.title: AI Loops support power targeting without firing
data.body:
I found the following while spectating an all-bot match:

![screen shot 2014-11-07 at 17 58 50](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/4948678/aa467054-66a8-11e4-9262-c52250d87de8.png)

The AI never actually fired the power, and instead spammed the chat log with many thousands of targeting debug entries.

data.title: OpenRA CodingStandard wiki page inaccuracy in method visibility
data.body:
The Coding standard wiki page states that we shouldn't explicitly declare methods as private as they are private by default. This isn't true though as in C# methods are by default internal (http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms173121.aspx)

edit: I suppose this means either a change to say don't explicitly define internal or a change to the code standard itself

data.title: Moved a few start location/spawn traits to Mods.Common
data.body: Left SpawnMPUnits in RA for now, as it uses Move and I don't want to open that can of worms just yet.

data.title: Ported window creation and input to OpenTK
data.body:
This updates https://github.com/flibitijibibo/SDL2-CS and replaces the missing bits with @OpenTK. When using the OpenTK renderer the SDL2 backend is still preferred especially on Mac OS X, but it is not a hard dependency anymore. The GameWindow will fall back to other native implementations. This has several advantages:
- We gain portability to platforms where SDL2 is not supported or installed. Writing a renderer for OpenGL ES can then target mobile devices or Windows users without OpenGL capable drivers when ANGLE translates these to the DirectX API for us.
- The outdated MiniTK we used before has been dropped by upstream. https://github.com/flibitijibibo/SDL2-CS/issues/20 We now use one library that is actively maintained with tagged releases. This also makes life easier for Linux packagers when they unbundle our thirdparty dependencies. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6863
- Personally I like the C#yfied API. I don't need constructs like OpenGl.Gl.gl\* to remind me of C namespaces/macros that look alien in the .NET world as I usually discover APIs through auto-complete in my IDE. This cleans up the code and allows even a newbie like me to work with these internals.
- I discovered that OpenTK can query display devices and change resolutions. This may help us resolve https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6405 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/4440. Also https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/3774 may be possible with the OnResize events.
- The latest releases http://www.opentk.com/news/opentk-1.1.2-stable-released-with-cocoa-backend promise a lot of performance optimization in binding initialization and memory usage. I hope we benefit from it and from the improvements contributed by the OpenTK community.

There are also some disadvantages or known issues:
- ~~I could not get PseudoFullscreen behavior to work so I removed it as also suggested in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6367.~~
- ~~Clipboard access is not yet implemented so I had to remove it. http://www.opentk.com/node/3699#comment-15838~~
- The window will always grab the mouse. You can ALT+TAB to lose focus, but there is no free mouse cursor. I did not find any settings to emulate this old behavior.
- We lost support for some key codes. Most of them seem exotic though.
- The OpenTK.dll is quite big with 3.8 MB which gives us an estimated +2 MB for the release packages.

Also this requires extensive testing on all currently supported platforms for regressions. It will also be interesting if we already support *BSD now. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5446

data.title: D2k - Shortened Stealth Raider Code
data.body: This also fixes stealth raider requires Heavy Factory to build.

data.title: Video Game Trailer - Post-Halloween Release
data.body:
I had a positive experience from a thread on Github that was about planning the preview video for the June release. Ideas, scripts and feedback was gathered onto one place which enabled me to complete a decent video in about 2-3 weeks. So why not do this again, only this time there is no real deadline and the sky's the limit :)

I've already begun working on a new trailer video - basically an improvement of the previous one made back in february. However, with a recent reply on a thread of mine on Sleipnir I was intrigued to explore alterations that could mean a more radical change from my original idea of a remake: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=287914#287914

Any suggestions or comments on this trailer will be taken into account - everything from broad ideas and visions to small nit-pickings of the finest details along the way. I will post updates on the project's status when necessary and visit this issue frequently to make sure I'm not missing anything.
